title: Baxt number on the Dankort (card) terminal
text: Baxt number on the Dankort (card) terminal 27 May 2022 15:32 If a customer asks for the baxt number, it can be found on the receipt e.g. TERM: xxxxxxxx-xxxxxx It is 6 numeric characters long and is used to create a gift card plan.
description:
Baxt number on the Dankort (card) terminal

27 May 2022

15:32

 

If a customer asks for the baxt number, it can be found on the receipt e.g. TERM: xxxxxxxx-xxxxxx

 

It is  6 numeric characters long and is used to create a gift card plan.

title: Card agreements – e.g. center cards
text: Card agreements – e.g. center cards 27 May 2022 15:33 If a customer wants to use a center card as payment, the shop needs to get a hold of the provider of their redemption agreement and have them add the center card. Then they should contact us and have Brian E update the Nets agreements.
description:
Card agreements – e.g. center cards

27 May 2022

15:33

 

If a customer wants to use a center card as payment,  the shop needs to get a hold of the provider of their redemption agreement and have them add the center card.

 

Then they should contact us and have Brian E update the Nets agreements.

title: Card agreements – error while getting card agreements
text: Card agreements – error while getting card agreements 27 May 2022 15:34 Swipe the shopping card on the terminal (is usually kept underneath the terminal) Press 7 Press 1 Press green button twice Press red button twice Swipe the shopping card again Press 1 Press 1
description:
Card agreements – error while getting card agreements

27 May 2022

15:34

 

  1. Swipe the shopping card on the terminal (is usually kept underneath the terminal)

 

  1. Press 7
      
  2. Press 1
      
  3. Press green button twice
      
  4. Press red button twice
      
  5. Swipe the shopping card again
      
  6. Press 1
      
  7. Press 1

title: Verifone P400 Configuration and setup
text: Verifone P400 Configuration and setup 22 March 2023 18:42 These Peds are not directly connected to the Pos hardware but reside separately on the network. The hardware is as below. The Ped has 2 main configuration setups that need to be set from the Keypad Setting the Ped from Manual to Integration Mode Press the * Key • Select the “Configuration” Menu • Enter the Supervisor Password 12345 and press enter • Select “POS” • select “Enable/Disable POS” • Select “Yes” The PED should now display "Waiting for Merchant Login" The Manual mode (Not Integration/Pos mode) can be used to process "Customer not present" and refund transactions by manually keying in customers data. Example below is how to do a CNP card refund Select Tick on the prompt to disable POS This will take the PED back to the main screen where instead of waiting for Merchant login, it will now say to enter login details Press green Tick on screen to get to the login screen Enter the users Login ID Press Tick on screen Enter the user Login PIN/Password Press Tick on screen This will now log you in and you will see the Sale screen – asking you to enter a value Press * Select “Card Not Present” Select “Refund Telephone Order” Enter the value to be refunded Press Tick on screen Merchant Reference isn’t need but can be entered if wanted Press Tick on screen – even if blank Enter Card Number Press Tick on screen Enter Expiry date of card Press Tick on screen Enter CSC Code from back of Card Press Tick on screen Say no to register for account on file if prompted This will now process the refund – for Sales you will also be prompted for first line of address, postcode and present you with the normal data match/not match etc and give you the option of whether to proceed if the data doesn’t match…this is not needed for refunds though After the transaction it will say Printer Not Attached – Press the red cross as you cannot print receipts Now you need to put the Ped back into POS mode Press * Press the Down icon to go down the menu page Select “Configuration” Supervisor Password: 12345 Select “POS” Select “Enable/Disable POS” Select Tick on the prompt to Enable POS You will now be taken back to the Waiting for Merchant Login screen – either wait for the connector to log the PED back in, or reboot the connector/restart the K3_Pay service on the connector Setting the Lan configuration on the Ped Once your PED has loaded up it should be saying either “Log In” if it is in non-integrated Mode or “Waiting for Merchant Login” if it is in Integrated Mode. • Press the * Key • Select the “Supervisor” Menu • Enter the Supervisor Password 12345 and press enter • Select “Communication” • Scroll down and select “Cofiguration” • Select “Network Interface” • Select “LAN” • Select “IPv4” • Select “DHCP” and change this to "NO" if you are using a static IP, After setting DHCP to No you will now find more options appear below, including IP Address, Subnet Mask and Gateway. Please note that when setting your IP details, the PED uses a 3-digit format on each part of the address. So if your address is 192.168.1.1 you will need to enter 192.168.001.001 • Select “IP Address” and Enter the IP Address that this device will be using • Select “Ok” • Select “Subnet Mask” and Enter the Subnet Mask address for your network • Select “Ok” • Select “Default Gateway” and Enter the Default Gateway address for your network • Select “Ok” • Select “DNS 1” and Enter the first DNS Address for your network • Select “Ok” • Select “DNS 2” and Enter the second DNS Address for your network • Select “Ok” If your site only has 1 DNS address, or if preferred, you can use Googles DNS servers. Googles DNS servers are: • 008.008.008.008 • 008.008.004.004 Once your IP details have been set, select the Back Arrow in the top left of the screen which will take you back to the LAN screen. • Select “Save” and it will save your config • Select “Ok” • Select “Yes” to Apply Settings on Interface • Select “Ok” once the interface has started Press the Red Cross button on the keyboard as many times as it takes to go back to the “Waiting for Merchant Login” screen
description:
Verifone P400 Configuration and setup

22 March 2023

18:42

 

These Peds are not directly connected to the Pos hardware but reside separately on the network.

 

The hardware is as below.

 

 

The Ped has 2 main configuration setups that need to be set from the Keypad

 

  1. Setting the Ped from Manual to Integration Mode

 

Press the * Key

 • Select the “Configuration” Menu

 • Enter the Supervisor Password 12345 and press enter

 • Select “POS”

 • select “Enable/Disable POS”

 • Select “Yes” The PED should now display "Waiting for Merchant Login"

 

The Manual mode (Not Integration/Pos mode) can be used to process "Customer not present" and refund transactions by manually keying in customers data.

 

Example below is how to do a CNP card refund

 

Select Tick on the prompt to disable POS

 

This will take the PED back to the main screen where instead of waiting for Merchant login, it will now say to enter login details

 

Press green Tick on screen to get to the login screen

Enter the users Login ID

Press Tick on screen

Enter the user Login PIN/Password

Press Tick on screen

 

This will now log you in and you will see the Sale screen – asking you to enter a value

 

Press *

Select “Card Not Present”

Select “Refund Telephone Order”

Enter the value to be refunded

Press Tick on screen

Merchant Reference isn’t need but can be entered if wanted

Press Tick on screen – even if blank

Enter Card Number

Press Tick on screen

Enter Expiry date of card

Press Tick on screen

Enter CSC Code from back of Card

Press Tick on screen

Say no to register for account on file if prompted

This will now process the refund – for Sales you will also be prompted for first line of address, postcode and present you with the normal data match/not match etc and give you the option of whether to proceed if the data doesn’t match…this is not needed for refunds though

After the transaction it will say Printer Not Attached – Press the red cross as you cannot print receipts

 

Now you need to put the Ped back into POS mode

 

Press *

Press the Down icon to go down the menu page

Select “Configuration”

Supervisor Password: 12345

Select “POS”

Select “Enable/Disable POS”

Select Tick on the prompt to Enable POS

 

You will now be taken back to the Waiting for Merchant Login screen – either wait for the connector to log the PED back in, or reboot the connector/restart the K3_Pay service on the connector

 

 

 

 

 

  1. Setting the Lan configuration on the Ped

 

Once your PED has loaded up it should be saying either “Log In” if it is in non-integrated Mode or “Waiting for Merchant Login” if it is in Integrated Mode. 

• Press the * Key

 • Select the “Supervisor” Menu

 • Enter the Supervisor Password 12345 and press enter

 • Select “Communication”

 • Scroll down and select “Cofiguration”

 • Select “Network Interface”

 • Select “LAN”

 • Select “IPv4”

 • Select “DHCP” and change this to "NO" if you are using a static IP, After setting DHCP to No you will now find more options appear below, including IP Address, Subnet Mask and Gateway. Please note that when setting your IP details, the PED uses a 3-digit format on each part of the address. So if your address is 192.168.1.1 you will need to enter 192.168.001.001

 • Select “IP Address” and Enter the IP Address that this device will be using 

• Select “Ok”

 • Select “Subnet Mask” and Enter the Subnet Mask address for your network

 • Select “Ok”

 • Select “Default Gateway” and Enter the Default Gateway address for your network

 • Select “Ok” • Select “DNS 1” and Enter the first DNS Address for your network

 • Select “Ok” • Select “DNS 2” and Enter the second DNS Address for your network

 • Select “Ok” If your site only has 1 DNS address, or if preferred, you can use Googles DNS servers. Googles DNS servers are: • 008.008.008.008 • 008.008.004.004 Once your IP details have been set, select the Back Arrow in the top left of the screen which will take you back to the LAN screen.

 • Select “Save” and it will save your config

 • Select “Ok”

 • Select “Yes” to Apply Settings on Interface

 • Select “Ok” once the interface has started Press the Red Cross button on the keyboard as many times as it takes to go back to the “Waiting for Merchant Login” screen

title: Card terminal – button missing on POS
text: Card terminal – button missing on POS 25 May 2022 13:24 If the card terminal works, the light is on, it is connected to the POS, but you still can't access it from the POS, check Adv. Configuration in DdDAdmin on the POS (password: ddd+2016). If UseTerminal is 0, then change to 1. Save (bottom of page) Run a reload on the POS. This should fix that problem.
description:
Card terminal – button missing on POS

25 May 2022

13:24

 

 

If the card terminal works, the light is on, it is connected to the POS, but you still can't access it from the POS, check Adv. Configuration in DdDAdmin on the POS (password: ddd+2016).  

 

 

 

If UseTerminal is 0, then change to  1.

 

Save (bottom of page)

 

Run a reload on the POS. This should fix that problem.

title: Missing Merchant Card for Card Terminal-NETS
text: When the customer receives their payment terminal, a merchant card is also included. The merchant card is required to access certain functions on the terminal. If a customer has lost their merchant card, they can order a new one from NETS terminal support or If the customer needs to change the settings on their terminal right now, they can also obtain their merchant code by contacting NETS technical support at phone number: 88 77 70 02.
description:
When the customer receives their payment terminal, a merchant card is also included.

The merchant card is required to access certain functions on the terminal.


If a customer has lost their merchant card, they can order a new one from NETS terminal support or


If the customer needs to change the settings on their terminal right now, they can also obtain their merchant code by contacting NETS technical support at phone number: 88 77 70 02.
